column3: May as well correct the entire comment while you're doing this:\n\n`// Tests these internal net_processing.cpp methods:`
Why not remove the name of the source file entirely?

It's useful to know where the transaction is being checked before it is added using this function. Otherwise I guess you could use grep to figure out where AcceptToMemoryPool() went but why not just say where it is? \n\nEdit: I guess if it moves again then this comment will need to be updated so that is a valid concern. I think that it is helpful enough to be worth that possibility, though.
grep, ack, tag files, ... there are many ways to find where the AcceptToMemoryPool() definition is. Naming the source file doesn't add any clarity here, and as you say adds cost to future refactors.
